Package panels

Class Visibility

java.lang.Object
panels.Visibility
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameVariables
public class Visibility extends Object implements GameVariables

This class handles drawing the visibility of the player in our game. The player has a circle around themselves which is what they can see. As time goes on, the circle gets smaller, making it harder for the player to see the maze.

Since:
March 25, 2024
Author:
Nick Clouse, Andrew Denegar, Molly O'Connor
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • single_instance

      private static Visibility single_instance
      The current instance of Visibility.

    • c

      private final Color c
      New 'blank' color that is transparent. Used to make the gradient go from black to transparent.

    • centerX

      private final int centerX
      Center x of the screen.
      See Also:

    • centerY

      private final int centerY
      Center y of the screen.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • colors

      private final Color[] colors
      Array of colors to use in the gradient.

    • decreaseAmount

      private int decreaseAmount
      Amount to decrease the radius by.

    • dist

      private final float[] dist
      New float[], used to determine the distribution of colors along the gradient.

    • leftSide

      private GeneralPath leftSide
      Stores the right side of the visibility shape. They are split into two sides so they are easier to draw. When they come together, they form a circle in the middle.

    • p

      private RadialGradientPaint p
      Color used for drawing the visibility. It's a gradient that goes from black to transparent.

    • startingRadius

      private final int startingRadius
      Starting radius of the circle.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • radius

      private int radius
      radius that will be updated and used to draw the circle.

    • rightSide

      private GeneralPath rightSide
      Stores the right side of the visibility shape. They are split into two sides so they are easier to draw. When they come together, they form a circle in the middle.

  • Constructor Details

    • Visibility

      private Visibility()
      Constructs a new Visibility object.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Visibility getInstance()
      Makes a new instance of Visibility. Visibility is a singleton, which means only one instance of Visibility can exist at a time. Visibility is a singleton because we only need one instance of it for our game, and don't want multiple instances to be made.
      Returns:
      The current instance of Visibility.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method, used for testing.
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments passed.

    • createVis

      public void createVis()
      Updates radius of visibility to current value of radius. Makes a new General path for each side.

    • drawVision

      public void drawVision(Graphics2D g2d)
      Draws the visibility circle around the player. Uses GeneralPath objects to make it look like there is a circle around the player.
      Parameters:
      g2d - the graphics to draw on.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets radius and decreaseAmount to default values.

    • updateRadius

      public void updateRadius()
      Decreases the radius by preset amount.
